content.text: HyperCard provides some useful tools for troubleshooting your scripts. These debugging tools let you step through a handler line by line as it runs, inspect the values of variables, and trace the flow of messages. To debug a handler, follow these steps: 1. Open the script that contains the message or function handler you want to debug.

2. Click to place the insertion point on the line with the on or function statement that defines the handler. Or, depending on where you want to start, place the insertion point on any statement of the handler that is not a comment.

on watchFibonacci show message watcher at "269,73" get fibonacci(5) set nextLine of message watcher to "Fibonacci(5) = " && it & return wait 4 seconds hide message watcher end watchFibonacci function fibonacci N wait 30 set nextLine of message watcher to "N = " && N & return if N = 0 or N = 1 then return 1 else return fibonacci(N - 1) + fibonacci(N - 2) end fibonacci
